method.name: Functional Trees

reference.ref: J. Gama, Functional Trees, Machine Learning, 55: 219-250, 2004

generalDescription.objective: To determine a decision tree that on the basis of answers to questions about the input attributes predicts correctly the value of the target attribute
generalDescription.howWork: Functional Trees is a framework to build decision trees and hybrid them with other classifiers. The decision tree is constructed top-down. In each step a test for the actual node is chosen (starting with the root node), which best separates the given examples by classes. After the building phase comes a pruning phase that prunes the tree and adds the other classifiers at the leaves of the tree.

parameterSpec.param: MinNumInstancesToSplit: Number of instances that a node should have in order to be considered a partitionable node
Split Criteria: Information measure that is going to be computed to chose the best separation of the classes
Prune Criteria: Way of pruning the tree and adding the classifiers at leaves
Classifier on leaves: Classifier that is going to be used at the leaves of the tree

K: the number of neighbours to be tested. If this value is too high (similar to the data size), then it is the near the majority class classifier. When it is too low, then it is the same as its very nearest instance.
